I'm thining of a 2 year Presidental term limit. The president should be in "power" for two years. 
 (Bush has done enough damage in his time, lol, jk)
 
 A term should equal two years. 
 A president should be able to serve 4 terms (8 years).
 
 Any ideas of how this could be a bad idea?
 As for all you lazy people out there that don't want to vote that often.... Don't give me that excuse.
 Although one downfall of this could be the constant change in goverment policy: (Other issues apply)
 Example Taxes 
 Up - Democrat 
 Down - Republican
 (continues up,down,up,down,up,etc....)
 
 
 Always Stay Open Minded

Bad idea. A President running for reelection will spend at least one year campaigning half-time and focusing on the Presidency half-time. Currently, that's one-fourth of the President's term that is spent focusing on reelection. Your system would increase that to one-half. Also, two years might not be enough for a President to prove whether or not he can lead the country well. When the President gets into office, he has to set policies, organize his government to exactly the way he wants it, etc. Then, by the time he's ready to get down to business, he has a few months before he's off to the campaign trail again.
i agree. i do not think any president should be reelected. aside from that, i think more groups, such as the greens, should have a greater chance. will never happen though.

Excuse my ignorance.... This was not a good idea
 
 Always Stay Open Minded
That's okay. With what you said to support it, it was actually a pretty good idea, but I just feel that there are too many down sides to it.
